Feature name: Prioritized scheduling of critical cluster addon pods
One Line Release Note Description: Ensure critical cluster infrastructure pods (Heapster, DNS, etc.) can schedule by evicting regular pods when necessary to make the critical pods schedule.
Allows an admission controller to determine whether a pod may be schdeuled based on a policy
Allows pods to require or prohibit (or prefer or prefer not) co-scheduling on the same node (or zone or other topology domain) as another set of pods.
Simplifies bootstrapping of TLS secured communication between the apiserver and kublet
Exposes authorization engine to external inquiries for delgation, inspection, and debugging
Pods now have alpha support for setting whitelisted, safe sysctls. Unsafe sysctls can be whitelisted on the kubelet.

Feature name: Source IP preservation for Virtual IPs
One Line Release Note Description: Service LB now has alpha support for preserving client source IP
Introducing 'ScheduledJobs', which allow running time based Jobs, n$amely once at a specified time or repeatedly at specified point in time.
Now in Alpha! New 'kubeadm' tool makes install much easier.
Publish node performance dashboard at http://node-perf-dash.k8s.io/#/builds
Generate audit logs for every request user performs against secured API server endpoint.

Federated Ingress allows creation of a single global virtual IP ("VIP"), via a single API call, to intelligently load balance L7 traffic across some or all federated clusters around the world. GKE and GCE are supported in this release.
Federated Namespaces make it easy to create and maintain (via a single API call) a consistent set of NameSpaces across a large number of clusters.
Introducing a new simplified mechanism to turn up federation. We will continue to support the existing mechanism in this release, but we recommend to switch to the new one.
Ingress now has alpha support for single master, multi-zone clusters

Feature name: Enable non-go clients: Move to Swagger 2.0
One Line Release Note Description: `kube-apiserver` now publishes a swagger 2.0 spec in addition to a swagger 1.2 spec.

Feature name: kubelet evicts resources when observing disk pressureke
One Line Release Note Description: kubelet is able to evict pods when it observes disk pressure
Persistent Volume provisioning now supports multiple provisioners using StorageClass configuration.
AppArmor profiles can be specified & applied to pod containers
Cluster policy to control access and defaults of security related features
Kubernetes clusters on GCE will be upgrading to Google ContainerVM Image (GCI) soon. Use it today by setting KUBE_NODE_OS_DISTRIBUTION env to "gci"

Federated Replica Sets automatically and intelligently distribute a specified replica count across multiple federated clusters, either equally or according to optionally specified relative cluster weights.  Hybrid cloud scenarios, where clusters are hosted in different cloud providers or on-premise are fully supported.
Federated Secrets make it easy to create and maintain (via a single API call) a consistent set of Secrets (e.g. security tokens) across a large number of clusters.
Federation API server gained support for events and many federation controllers now report important events.
Automate docker validation processes
Link To Docs: Note from @dchen1107: For validation test framework, I don't think we need any doc except release notes mentioning which docker version being qualified.

Feature name: System Correctness: Single Source for Default Values
One Line Release Note Description: `kubectl` no longer applies defaults before sending objects to the server in create and update requests, allowing the server to apply the defaults.
New volume plugin for the Quobyte Distributed File System

Feature name: New Volume Plugin: Azure Data Disk
One Line Release Note Description: New volume plugin for Azure Data Disk
